page.title: 01THE ISLE OF CANNA
page.content: The island of Canna is the most westerly of the Small Isles of the Inner Hebrides. It is almost 5 miles long and 1 mile wide. The island of Sanday, which is connected to Canna by a footbridge, is nearly 2 miles long and up to 0.75 miles wide. The two islands are hereafter referred to collectively as Canna. The population of Canna is currently 17 people (June 1985). The majority of those employed work for The National Trust for Scotland who were given the island in 1981 by the previous owner Dr John Lorne Campbell. Canna has been treated as a bird sanctuary since 1938. The whole island is farmed but is designated a Nature Conservancy Site of Special Scientific Interest .
